intro: Achyranthes fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Its stems are often hairy and can exude a milky sap when damaged. It is often found in wetlands, along stream banks, and in other humid environments.
